- Microfinance Loan Policy Document
** Version 2.0 I Effective Date: 26 September 2025
>>> Old Content: Version 1.0 I Effective Date: 15 March 2022
>>> Reason for Change: Updated version number and effective date to reflect incorporation of RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025).
- Approved By: Board of Directors, Cognizant BFS Bank
- Prepared By: Credit Policy & Risk Department
- Classification: Internal Use Only
- 1. Purpose and Objective
- This policy defines the framework for sanctioning, monitoring and recovering microfinance
- loans under Cognizant BFS Bank's financial inclusion initiative. The objective is to provide
- access to credit for low-income households and micro-entrepreneurs while maintaining
- sound asset quality and compliance with RBI regulations.
- 2. Scope
- This policy applies to all microfinance loan products offered by the Bank to eligible
- borrowers through branches and Business Correspondent (BC) channels.
- It covers loan origination, credit appraisal, pricing, disbursement, repayment, and post-
- disbursement monitoring.
- 3. Definitions
- 
- --- TABLE START ---
- Term              : Definition
- Microfinance Loan : A collateral-free loan not exceeding ₹1 lakh to a household having annual income ≤ ₹2 lakh (rural) or ₹2.5 lakh (urban).
- Household         : Individuals related by blood or marriage sharing the same kitchen.
- Group Lending     : Loans extended to Joint Liability Groups (JLGs) or Self-Help Groups (SHGs).
** Key Facts Statement (KFS) : A summary document containing interest rate methodology, all charges and fees, repayment schedule, prepayment terms, and security details, provided to borrowers at sanction/disbursement.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new definition.
>>> Reason for Change: Added definition as per RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 2.1 requiring KFS disclosure to all borrowers.
** External Benchmark : The reference rate (such as RBI Repo Rate) to which floating rate loans are linked as per RBI Master Direction on Interest Rate on Advances.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new definition.
>>> Reason for Change: Added definition to support new external benchmarking requirements under RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 1.1.
- --- TABLE END ---
- 
- 
- 4. Policy Objectives
- a) To promote income-generation and self-employment among economically weaker
- sections.
- b) To ensure transparent and fair lending practices.
- c) To minimize credit and operational risk through standardized procedures.
- d) To achieve priority-sector lending targets.
** e) To ensure borrower protection through comprehensive disclosure and grievance redressal mechanisms.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new objective.
>>> Reason for Change: Added new policy objective to align with borrower rights and protection requirements under RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 8.
- 5. Eligibility Criteria
- a) Borrower must be a resident of India, aged 18-60 years.
- b) Minimum membership of a JLG/SHG for group loans.
- c) Household income certified by a designated field officer.
- d) No member of the household should be a defaulter with any financial institution.
- e) Credit information to be checked through CIC database (CIBIL, Equifax etc.).
- 6. Loan Quantum and Tenure
- a) Maximum loan per borrower: ₹1 lakh.
- b) Repayment period: Up to 36 months including grace period (if any).
- c) Repeat loans permitted after successful repayment of previous loan.
- 7. Interest Rate and Charges
** a) Interest rate for floating rate microfinance loans shall be linked to the RBI Repo Rate as the external benchmark. The Effective Interest Rate shall be computed as: RBI Repo Rate + Bank Spread = Final Rate. The current RBI Repo Rate (as on 26th September 2025) is 6.50%. The Bank Spread shall be disclosed explicitly to the borrower in the Key Facts Statement.
>>> Old Content: Interest rate to be linked to the Bank's Base Rate + risk premium.
>>> Reason for Change: Updated to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 1.1 and 1.2 requiring external benchmarking to RBI Repo Rate and explicit disclosure of Bank Spread.
- b) Processing fee: Up to 1% of loan amount (non-refundable).
- c) Penal interest: 2% p.a. on overdue instalments.
** d) All rates and charges to be disclosed at the time of sanction through sanction letter and Key Facts Statement (KFS). The KFS shall be provided in a language understood by the borrower and shall include: interest rate and methodology, all applicable charges and fees, repayment schedule and amortisation details, prepayment terms and conditions, and security and collateral details.
>>> Old Content: All rates and charges to be disclosed at the time of sanction through sanction letter.
>>> Reason for Change: Enhanced disclosure requirements as per RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 2.1 and 2.2 mandating provision of KFS in borrower's language with comprehensive details.
** e) Any revision in the RBI Repo Rate benchmark shall be communicated to the borrower within three months of such change, and the interest rate shall be reset in accordance with the benchmark methodology.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 1.4 and 3.1 requiring timely communication of benchmark rate changes and reset mechanism.
** f) Prepayment of floating rate microfinance loans shall be permitted without penalty. For any fixed rate loans, prepayment penalty shall be capped at 2% of the outstanding principal.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added prepayment terms as mandated by RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 4.1, 4.2, and 4.3.
- 8. Collateral and Security
- a) Microfinance loans are collateral-free.
- b) Personal guarantee of group members serves as credit substitute in JLG/SHG models.
- c) No margin money required.
** d) Where any security or collateral is taken, the loan agreement shall contain a detailed description of the secured asset, including nature of collateral, lien rights of the lender, and conditions for enforcement and release.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 5.1 requiring detailed description of security arrangements even though microfinance loans are typically collateral-free.
- 9. Loan Appraisal and Sanction
- a) Credit Officer to collect application and verify KYC documents.
- b) Household income and debt assessment performed via field visit.
- c) Loan Proposal Form to be approved by Branch Manager up to ₹50,000; by Regional
- Office up to ₹1 lakh.
- d) Sanction based on repayment capacity and group reputation.
** e) A Key Facts Statement (KFS) shall be furnished to all borrowers at the time of sanction, and the borrower's acknowledgement of understanding shall be obtained. The KFS shall be appended to the loan agreement as a summary box.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 2.1, 2.2, and 2.3 requiring KFS provision and borrower acknowledgement.
- 10. Disbursement Procedure
- a) Disbursement only after completion of documentation and training session on loan
- terms.
- b) Funds to be credited directly to borrower's SB account or through BC channel.
- c) Disbursement must not exceed sanctioned limit.
** d) The loan agreement and Key Facts Statement shall be provided to the borrower in English and/or local language as per borrower's preference at the time of disbursement.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 8.1 ensuring borrower rights to receive documents in understood language.
- 11. Repayment Mechanism
- a) Equal monthly instalments (EMIs) preferred.
- b) Collection through auto-debit or cash collection by authorized BC agents.
- c) Grace period up to 15 days permitted for unavoidable delays.
- d) Delinquency beyond 30 days to be classified as Special Mention Account (SMA-1).
** e) Any modification to repayment terms shall require explicit borrower consent.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 3.2 requiring borrower consent for term modifications.
- 12. Monitoring and Supervision
- a) Branch to conduct monthly review of portfolio quality.
- b) Field staff to submit visit reports for random 10% of active borrowers.
- c) Audit Department to verify loan files quarterly.
- d) Any deviation from policy requires Regional Office approval.
** e) The Bank shall undertake constructive post-disbursement supervision, particularly for loans up to ₹2 lakh, to ensure responsible lending and borrower protection.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 6.1 requiring post-disbursement supervision for borrower protection.
- 13. Recovery Process
- a) Soft reminders and counselling for initial delinquency.
- b) Legal action initiated after 90 days of non-payment.
- c) Recovery through Lok Adalat / SARFAESI where applicable.
- d) Write-off as per Board-approved Write-Off Policy.
** e) Upon full repayment of the loan and subject to any valid liens, the Bank shall initiate the release of collateral (if any) without undue delay.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 7.1 requiring timely release of securities upon loan repayment.
- 14. Risk Management
- a) Portfolio diversification limits: No single district > 20% of microfinance portfolio.
- b) Credit Bureau report mandatory for each applicant.
- c) Operational risk controlled through dual custody of cash and periodic reconciliation.
- 15. Compliance and Audit
** a) Adherence to RBI Master Circular on Microcredit (2011), RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) issued under Sections 21, 35A and 56 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, and all subsequent notifications.
>>> Old Content: Adherence to RBI Master Circular on Microcredit (2011) and subsequent notifications.
>>> Reason for Change: Updated to include compliance with new RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) and relevant statutory provisions.
- b) Compliance Officer to report quarterly to Board on policy implementation.
** 16. Borrower Rights and Grievance Redressal
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new section.
>>> Reason for Change: Added new section to comply with RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 8 establishing borrower rights and grievance mechanisms.
** a) Borrowers shall have the right to receive the loan agreement and Key Facts Statement in English and/or local language as per their preference.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Incorporated borrower right from RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 8.1.
** b) The Bank shall designate a Nodal Officer for grievance redressal. The Nodal Officer's name and contact details shall be communicated to all borrowers at the time of loan sanction.
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added as per RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 8.2 requiring designation of Nodal Officer for grievance redressal.
** c) If grievances remain unresolved within 30 days, borrowers may escalate the matter to the Banking Ombudsman under the RBI Integrated Ombudsman Scheme (RB-IOS).
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a completely new provision.
>>> Reason for Change: Added escalation mechanism as per RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) Section 8.3.
** 17. Review and Amendment
>>> Old Content: 16. Review and Amendment
>>> Reason for Change: Section renumbered due to addition of new Section 16 on Borrower Rights and Grievance Redressal.
- a) This policy shall be reviewed annually or earlier if directed by the RBI or if significant
- operational changes occur.
- b) Amendments require approval from the Board of Directors.
- Approval Record
- 
- --- TABLE START ---
- Version : Date   		: Approved By 		: Remarks
- 1.0     : 15 Mar 2022 	: Board of Directors    : Initial issue aligned with RBI Microcredit guidelines 2011
** 2.0     : 26 Sep 2025 	: Board of Directors    : Updated to incorporate RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) including external benchmarking, KFS disclosure, prepayment terms, borrower rights, and grievance redressal mechanisms
>>> Old Content: N/A - This is a new version entry.
>>> Reason for Change: Added new version record to document incorporation of RBI Guidelines on Loan Agreements (2025) and all associated policy updates.
- --- TABLE END ---"}]
